intro: Erythracanthus obtusus, commonly known as the blunt-fruited erythracanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are often bright red or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erythracanthus obtusus is a hardy plant that thrives in full sun and requires minimal water once established.
